column4: HI, i just installed ubuntu and cant get xserver configured. I go through the xorgcfg -textmode prompts and write it to the file, then i went to check the file and it didn't exist.. so i ran xorgcfg again and this time i got write failed! file not written
no idea, but from what you're saying you want to write the Xorg config file, is that right ?
if so, you'll need to be root, and so you should use sudo
